column4: Ok.  I only have 1 slight problem.  101 is supposedly taken but I have no devices that are taking it lol.  See my Desktop is 100 and then my laptop is 102 (I have NO IDEA where 101 is being used at)
can you ping it? Are you using wifi?
it's unpingable and yes I am on wireless
yes but they have to be up and running.
you're basing the assumption of a 101 device on the fact that your devices are 100 and 102, yes? What's running the DHCP server?
Exactly what I am basing that on
Oh: and can you currently ping 100 and 102 from eachother?
No, I'm asking you, how do you know theres a 101 device?
let me double check that
because my internal ips aren't in synch.  If 101 wasn't being used wouldn't it be picked up and used and not skipped?
okay that's what I thought you were saying: just double-checking.

it is possible that one of your other devices had temporarily got 101, and then were reassigned for one reason or another. If your network's not locked down, it's also possible a neighbor or somesuch was using it temporarily. But, if they're not currently connected, you wouldn't be able to determine much. /Except/, your DHCP server should have a record of what MAC address it assigned 101 to.
were you able to ping?
can I get you in a side window cuz I would like to see if something picked up on my mac address just dont know ho to do that lol
Ok I will stay here :) lol
what operating system is your DHCP server running on?
Linux Ubuntu Dapper 6.06
what program are you using as the dhcp server?
I dont know what you mean lol.  I am using a Linksys wireless router that has dhcp enabled
what does ^^ mean
Yes I do

I probably can't tell you much more than to look at your router's documentation, and try to find out where it keeps logs of assigning IPs to MAC addresses (it may be fairly intuitive from the interface)
I can tell you this I JUST turned my laptop on and it went straight to 102 and my desktop is 100 lol.  I am gonna search the logs now ty
